clinical_study.brief_title: Conduction Abnormalities With Severe Aortic Stenosis Before and After Transcatheter Aortic Valve Replacement
clinical_study.official_title: Prevalence and Significance of Bradycardic Arrhythmias and Conduction Abnormalities Among Patients With Severe Aortic Stenosis Before and After Transcatheter Aortic Valve Replacement Using Extended Heart Rhythm Recording (Brady-TAVR Study)

brief_summary.textblock: Most of the conduction abnormalities with TAVR are usually detected during the procedure or during the following days of observation. Little is known about the prevalence and timing of any conduction abnormalities that exist before (other than standard ECG) or after through long term cardiac monitoring.

detailed_description.textblock:
Each subject who fulfills the inclusion/exclusion criteria will be provided with Zio patch for 2 weeks before TAVR. Immediately after the procedure, patients will be admitted per TAVR protocol and will be on telemetry. Data about their ECGs and any arrhythmias will be collected.
Upon discharge, patients will be provided with another Zio patch for 2 weeks. At the 2-3 months follow up, subjects will be provided with a third Zio patch for 2 weeks

primary_outcome.description: the prevalence of brady arrhythmia (Sinus brady, Sinus Pauses, AV Block, Bundle Branch Block) among patients with severe aortic stenosis who undergo TAVR using an extended cardiac rhythm monitor (Zio Patch) and determine if the brady arrhythmias predict the need for a pacemaker.

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of in hospital brady arrhythmia post TAVR
secondary_outcome.description: the prevalence of brady arrhythmia (Sinus brady, Sinus pause, AV block, Bundle branch block) using hospital telemetry data

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of brady arrhythmia after discharge from hospital post TAVR
secondary_outcome.description: the prevalence of brady arrhythmia (Sinus brady, Sinus pauses, AV block, Bundle branch block) using extended cardiac rhythm monitor (Zio Patch)

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of delayed brady arrhythmia post TAVR
secondary_outcome.description: the prevalence of brady arrhythmia using extended cardiac rhythm Assess the prevalence of brady arrhythmia (Sinus brady, Sinus Pause, AV block, Bundle branch block) using extended cardiac rhythm monitor (Zio Patch)

intervention.description: Ziopatch applied 2 weeks prior to procedure
Ziopatch applied at discharge from hospital to be worn for 2 weeks
Ziopatch applied 2 months from procedure to be worn for 2 weeks

study_pop.textblock: Patients to be scheduled for TAVR without preexisting Cardiac Implantable Electronic Device (CIED) can be screen and enrolled

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age > 18 and <90 years old
2. Able to provide informed consent
3. Willing to follow up at Cleveland Clinic (per TAVR protocol)
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Prior CIED (Pacemaker or defibrillator)
2. Unable to provide consent
3. Unable to follow up at Cleveland Clinic per TAVR protocol
